ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] HTML5 and RESTful HTTP in browsers
ygData.msgSnippet: But if the server wants to link to a particular content-type only, then isn t that a different resource? Cos tomorrow, the other server could stop serving that

But if the server wants to link to a particular content-type only,
then isn't that a different resource? Cos tomorrow, the other server
could stop serving that particular content-type from that resource? In
that case, the URL should contain the Content-type, imho.

My  argument is : there is server side negotiation and there is agent
driven negotiation (in RFC i.e). An Accept: in the <a>,<img> links in
neither.

Cheers
Devdatta
